docs.snippet: Hundreds of Kentucky teachers called in sick Friday to protest last-minute changes to their pension system, forcing nearly two dozen districts to close while angry educators rallied outside the governor's office to demand he not sign the bill.

headline.print_headline: Kentucky Districts Call Off Classes Due to Teacher Absences
headline.main: Kentucky Districts Call Off Classes Due to Teacher Absences

docs.snippet: Nervous stock investors are hoping an unusually U.S. strong earnings season can restore some of the optimism that characterized equity markets last year.

headline.print_headline: Eager for Calming News, Investors Look to Earnings
headline.main: Eager for Calming News, Investors Look to Earnings

docs.snippet: European investors have raised their bond allocations in March while keeping their equity exposure at six-month lows, in a month marked by a sharp tech sector selloff and brewing trade tensions that threatened to dent world economic growth.

headline.print_headline: European Funds Buy Bonds, See Euro Growth Cycle Peak-Reuters Poll
headline.main: European Funds Buy Bonds, See Euro Growth Cycle Peak-Reuters Poll

docs.snippet: Spooked by brewing trade tensions and a broad reversal in technology shares, global investors have cut their equity exposure to a four-month low this month while reducing their holdings of U.S. stocks to the lowest in nearly two years.

headline.print_headline: Global Funds Cut Stock Exposure to Four-Month Low Amid Trade War Fears
headline.main: Global Funds Cut Stock Exposure to Four-Month Low Amid Trade War Fears

docs.snippet: As Mark Zuckerberg prepares to testify before Congress over Facebook's privacy fiasco, public-relations experts who have prepped CEOs before have plenty of advice on handling the hot seat.

headline.print_headline: Zuckerberg's Congressional Survival Guide: Tips From Experts
headline.main: Zuckerberg's Congressional Survival Guide: Tips From Experts

docs.snippet: The widow of the gunman who slaughtered 49 people at a gay nightclub in Orlando, Florida, was acquitted Friday of helping to plot the attack and lying to the FBI afterward — a rare and stinging defeat for the U.S. government in a terrorism c...

headline.print_headline: Nightclub Gunman's Widow Sobs as Jury Finds Her Not Guilty
headline.main: Nightclub Gunman's Widow Sobs as Jury Finds Her Not Guilty

headline.main: Widow of Orlando Nightclub Gunman Is Acquitted in the Attack

docs.snippet: Did you stay up to date this week?

headline.main: News Quiz: Test Your Knowledge of the Week’s Headlines

docs.snippet: Kentucky's governor is praising the quick response to a man who allegedly killed his wife and then was fatally shot by officers outside his son's high school.

headline.print_headline: Kentucky Police Kill Suspect in Wife's Death Outside School
headline.main: Kentucky Police Kill Suspect in Wife's Death Outside School

docs.snippet: Nine years after a judge began supervising a multitude of federal lawsuits that claim homes were damaged by Chinese drywall, he says it's time to return thousands of remaining cases for trial in the courts where they were filed.

headline.print_headline: Judge: Return Chinese Drywall Lawsuits to Original States
headline.main: Judge: Return Chinese Drywall Lawsuits to Original States
